        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        Description #1 by frank...@gmail.com (Jul 2, 2022)

        Description #1 by frank...@gmail.com (Jul 2, 2022)

      Third party android application is able to bypass and download apk file without file extension warning. <span class="line"><!---->Third party android application is able to bypass and download apk file without file extension warning. <!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.70] + [stable]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.70] + [stable]<!----></span><br>Operating System: [Android] [Tested on Samsung Galaxy A12 with Android 11]<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: [Android] [Tested on Samsung Galaxy A12 with Android 11]<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>1: Install the attached application keyboard.apk. When the application is installed go to settings/general management/keyboard list and default and select the installed software keyboard (key2).<span class="line"><!---->1: Install the attached application keyboard.apk. When the application is installed go to settings/general management/keyboard list and default and select the installed software keyboard (key2).<!----></span><br><br>2: Open chrome and select the search bar. Press the POC button on the keyboard and chrome will download the Silence massage application without warning that the apk file could be dangerous.<span class="line"><!---->2: Open chrome and select the search bar. Press the POC button on the keyboard and chrome will download the Silence massage application without warning that the apk file could be dangerous.<!----></span><br><br>Optional: Go to settings/apps/key2 and allow storage permission, install unknown apps permission and all file access permission. This cause the app to try to install the file after downloading. This step is not necessary to prove that it is possible to bypass the download restrictions. <span class="line"><!---->Optional: Go to settings/apps/key2 and allow storage permission, install unknown apps permission and all file access permission. This cause the app to try to install the file after downloading. This step is not necessary to prove that it is possible to bypass the download restrictions. <!----></span><br><br><br>How this work:<span class="line"><!---->How this work:<!----></span><br>The application listens for an key event (Keyboard.KEYCODE_DELETE). When the key is pressed the keyboard injects a string/URL into the search bar. Chrome then loads the url and downloads the file.<span class="line"><!---->The application listens for an key event (Keyboard.KEYCODE_DELETE). When the key is pressed the keyboard injects a string/URL into the search bar. Chrome then loads the url and downloads the file.<!----></span><br><br><br>Files attached:<span class="line"><!---->Files attached:<!----></span><br>keyboard.apk - Proof of concept application.<span class="line"><!---->keyboard.apk - Proof of concept application.<!----></span><br>poc_class.txt - Text file with the java class injecting the URL.<span class="line"><!---->poc_class.txt - Text file with the java class injecting the URL.<!----></span><br>AA.mp4 - Proof of concept video.<span class="line"><!---->AA.mp4 - Proof of concept video.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
          
      
        
          
          AA.avi<b><!---->AA.avi<!----></b>
          
        <div class="filename">
          
          <b><!---->AA.avi<!----></b>
          
        </div>

        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1341485#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 6, 2022, 9:06 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          drubery@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          drubery@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This could possibly be considered a permissions bypass due to the suppressed dialog, though custom keyboards are very powerful/privileged pieces of software on the platform and generally speaking, existing installed malware is capable of significant damage outside of this use case. Redirecting to drubery@ to determine which side of our threat model this falls on.<span class="line"><!---->This could possibly be considered a permissions bypass due to the suppressed dialog, though custom keyboards are very powerful/privileged pieces of software on the platform and generally speaking, existing installed malware is capable of significant damage outside of this use case. Redirecting to drubery@ to determine which side of our threat model this falls on.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I share the concerns that this is outside our threat model. Couldn't the local malware just download the APK itself?<span class="line"><!---->I share the concerns that this is outside our threat model. Couldn't the local malware just download the APK itself?<!----></span><br><br>Even if it cant, I'm not sure the attached video demonstrates a download protection bypass. apk files are marked as "ALLOW_ON_USER_GESTURE" which can be very difficult to trigger, due to the fact that Safe Browsing verdicts usually override them. @frankapp.it - do you get a warning when you download that URL directly, without using your keyboard? Can you share a screenshot of that warning?<span class="line"><!---->Even if it cant, I'm not sure the attached video demonstrates a download protection bypass. apk files are marked as "ALLOW_ON_USER_GESTURE" which can be very difficult to trigger, due to the fact that Safe Browsing verdicts usually override them. @frankapp.it - do you get a warning when you download that URL directly, without using your keyboard? Can you share a screenshot of that warning?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        If I enter the URL address manually in the search field, I get no warning and the apk file is downloaded. If I visit the URL from a link or via a intent call from another application, I get the alert dialog. (see Harmful_file1.jpg) If I visit the website that hosts the file and I select it for download, I get a warning dialog (see Harmful_file2.jpg). <span class="line"><!---->If I enter the URL address manually in the search field, I get no warning and the apk file is downloaded. If I visit the URL from a link or via a intent call from another application, I get the alert dialog. (see Harmful_file1.jpg) If I visit the website that hosts the file and I select it for download, I get a warning dialog (see Harmful_file2.jpg). <!----></span><br>All above applies if I use safe browsing mode (see Enhanced_protection.jpg). (I also noticed that the injected URL does not appear under the history tab after injection.)<span class="line"><!---->All above applies if I use safe browsing mode (see Enhanced_protection.jpg). (I also noticed that the injected URL does not appear under the history tab after injection.)<!----></span><br><br>Local malware can download the application on its own. I used the keyboard apk as proof of the concept that a third party software could download via Chrome without any warning. I think this is dangerous and users should always be warned that this type of file could harm their cellphone.<span class="line"><!---->Local malware can download the application on its own. I used the keyboard apk as proof of the concept that a third party software could download via Chrome without any warning. I think this is dangerous and users should always be warned that this type of file could harm their cellphone.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I tested everthing in my last post on an iphone 12 with chrome installed as a reference. In all cases chrome warns before any download starts. Even though  apk files are not functional in iOS.<span class="line"><!---->I tested everthing in my last post on an iphone 12 with chrome installed as a reference. In all cases chrome warns before any download starts. Even though  apk files are not functional in iOS.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      drubery@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->drubery@chromium.org<!----></span>

        on
        
      Mon, Jul 18, 2022, 8:04 PM EDT

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1341485#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jul 18, 2022, 8:04 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1341485#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jul 18, 2022, 8:04 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        "If I enter the URL address manually in the search field, I get no warning and the apk file is downloaded." - When I do this, I see the attached prompt. When the user is directly choosing the filename (and therefore file extension), we don't show these file type warnings.<span class="line"><!---->"If I enter the URL address manually in the search field, I get no warning and the apk file is downloaded." - When I do this, I see the attached prompt. When the user is directly choosing the filename (and therefore file extension), we don't show these file type warnings.<!----></span><br><br>I don't think the keyboard apk is interesting from a security perspective, since downloading a file through Chrome is strictly worse than downloading itself.<span class="line"><!---->I don't think the keyboard apk is interesting from a security perspective, since downloading a file through Chrome is strictly worse than downloading itself.<!----></span><br><br>I think everything is working as intended here.<span class="line"><!---->I think everything is working as intended here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Re <span class="line"><!---->Re <!----></span>#c13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c13"><!---->#c13<!----></a>: On Android, Chrome considers a download to be legitimate if the user navigated to the download URL via the omnibox. See this comment[1]. So I think it's WAI. drubery@, could you provide an update on this issue?         Thanks xinghuilu@ for the pointer in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks xinghuilu@ for the pointer in <!----></span>#c20<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c20"><!---->#c20<!----></a>. There's very little value in telling a user that a download is dangerous if the only thing we know about it is the file type, so we're trying to minimize how often we do that. I don't think this scenario meets the bar for showing a warning based on file type alone.<span class="line"><!---->. There's very little value in telling a user that a download is dangerous if the only thing we know about it is the file type, so we're trying to minimize how often we do that. I don't think this scenario meets the bar for showing a warning based on file type alone.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;

        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;

          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

        mr-issue-page {

          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;

          min-width: 256px;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }

    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1341485: Third party android application is able to bypass and download apk file without file extension warning

      Third party android application is able to bypass and download apk file without file extension warning. <span class="line"><!---->Third party android application is able to bypass and download apk file without file extension warning. <!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.70] + [stable]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.70] + [stable]<!----></span><br>Operating System: [Android] [Tested on Samsung Galaxy A12 with Android 11]<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: [Android] [Tested on Samsung Galaxy A12 with Android 11]<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>1: Install the attached application keyboard.apk. When the application is installed go to settings/general management/keyboard list and default and select the installed software keyboard (key2).<span class="line"><!---->1: Install the attached application keyboard.apk. When the application is installed go to settings/general management/keyboard list and default and select the installed software keyboard (key2).<!----></span><br><br>2: Open chrome and select the search bar. Press the POC button on the keyboard and chrome will download the Silence massage application without warning that the apk file could be dangerous.<span class="line"><!---->2: Open chrome and select the search bar. Press the POC button on the keyboard and chrome will download the Silence massage application without warning that the apk file could be dangerous.<!----></span><br><br>Optional: Go to settings/apps/key2 and allow storage permission, install unknown apps permission and all file access permission. This cause the app to try to install the file after downloading. This step is not necessary to prove that it is possible to bypass the download restrictions. <span class="line"><!---->Optional: Go to settings/apps/key2 and allow storage permission, install unknown apps permission and all file access permission. This cause the app to try to install the file after downloading. This step is not necessary to prove that it is possible to bypass the download restrictions. <!----></span><br><br><br>How this work:<span class="line"><!---->How this work:<!----></span><br>The application listens for an key event (Keyboard.KEYCODE_DELETE). When the key is pressed the keyboard injects a string/URL into the search bar. Chrome then loads the url and downloads the file.<span class="line"><!---->The application listens for an key event (Keyboard.KEYCODE_DELETE). When the key is pressed the keyboard injects a string/URL into the search bar. Chrome then loads the url and downloads the file.<!----></span><br><br><br>Files attached:<span class="line"><!---->Files attached:<!----></span><br>keyboard.apk - Proof of concept application.<span class="line"><!---->keyboard.apk - Proof of concept application.<!----></span><br>poc_class.txt - Text file with the java class injecting the URL.<span class="line"><!---->poc_class.txt - Text file with the java class injecting the URL.<!----></span><br>AA.mp4 - Proof of concept video.<span class="line"><!---->AA.mp4 - Proof of concept video.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          drubery@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          drubery@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This could possibly be considered a permissions bypass due to the suppressed dialog, though custom keyboards are very powerful/privileged pieces of software on the platform and generally speaking, existing installed malware is capable of significant damage outside of this use case. Redirecting to drubery@ to determine which side of our threat model this falls on.<span class="line"><!---->This could possibly be considered a permissions bypass due to the suppressed dialog, though custom keyboards are very powerful/privileged pieces of software on the platform and generally speaking, existing installed malware is capable of significant damage outside of this use case. Redirecting to drubery@ to determine which side of our threat model this falls on.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I share the concerns that this is outside our threat model. Couldn't the local malware just download the APK itself?<span class="line"><!---->I share the concerns that this is outside our threat model. Couldn't the local malware just download the APK itself?<!----></span><br><br>Even if it cant, I'm not sure the attached video demonstrates a download protection bypass. apk files are marked as "ALLOW_ON_USER_GESTURE" which can be very difficult to trigger, due to the fact that Safe Browsing verdicts usually override them. @frankapp.it - do you get a warning when you download that URL directly, without using your keyboard? Can you share a screenshot of that warning?<span class="line"><!---->Even if it cant, I'm not sure the attached video demonstrates a download protection bypass. apk files are marked as "ALLOW_ON_USER_GESTURE" which can be very difficult to trigger, due to the fact that Safe Browsing verdicts usually override them. @frankapp.it - do you get a warning when you download that URL directly, without using your keyboard? Can you share a screenshot of that warning?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      frank...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->frank...@gmail.com<!----></span>

    <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jul 8, 2022, 1:40 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1341485#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jul 8, 2022, 1:40 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1341485#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jul 8, 2022, 1:40 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        If I enter the URL address manually in the search field, I get no warning and the apk file is downloaded. If I visit the URL from a link or via a intent call from another application, I get the alert dialog. (see Harmful_file1.jpg) If I visit the website that hosts the file and I select it for download, I get a warning dialog (see Harmful_file2.jpg). <span class="line"><!---->If I enter the URL address manually in the search field, I get no warning and the apk file is downloaded. If I visit the URL from a link or via a intent call from another application, I get the alert dialog. (see Harmful_file1.jpg) If I visit the website that hosts the file and I select it for download, I get a warning dialog (see Harmful_file2.jpg). <!----></span><br>All above applies if I use safe browsing mode (see Enhanced_protection.jpg). (I also noticed that the injected URL does not appear under the history tab after injection.)<span class="line"><!---->All above applies if I use safe browsing mode (see Enhanced_protection.jpg). (I also noticed that the injected URL does not appear under the history tab after injection.)<!----></span><br><br>Local malware can download the application on its own. I used the keyboard apk as proof of the concept that a third party software could download via Chrome without any warning. I think this is dangerous and users should always be warned that this type of file could harm their cellphone.<span class="line"><!---->Local malware can download the application on its own. I used the keyboard apk as proof of the concept that a third party software could download via Chrome without any warning. I think this is dangerous and users should always be warned that this type of file could harm their cellphone.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        "If I enter the URL address manually in the search field, I get no warning and the apk file is downloaded." - When I do this, I see the attached prompt. When the user is directly choosing the filename (and therefore file extension), we don't show these file type warnings.<span class="line"><!---->"If I enter the URL address manually in the search field, I get no warning and the apk file is downloaded." - When I do this, I see the attached prompt. When the user is directly choosing the filename (and therefore file extension), we don't show these file type warnings.<!----></span><br><br>I don't think the keyboard apk is interesting from a security perspective, since downloading a file through Chrome is strictly worse than downloading itself.<span class="line"><!---->I don't think the keyboard apk is interesting from a security perspective, since downloading a file through Chrome is strictly worse than downloading itself.<!----></span><br><br>I think everything is working as intended here.<span class="line"><!---->I think everything is working as intended here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks xinghuilu@ for the pointer in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks xinghuilu@ for the pointer in <!----></span>#c20<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c20"><!---->#c20<!----></a>. There's very little value in telling a user that a download is dangerous if the only thing we know about it is the file type, so we're trying to minimize how often we do that. I don't think this scenario meets the bar for showing a warning based on file type alone.<span class="line"><!---->. There's very little value in telling a user that a download is dangerous if the only thing we know about it is the file type, so we're trying to minimize how often we do that. I don't think this scenario meets the bar for showing a warning based on file type alone.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }

          display: block;

          max-height: 500px;

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          </tbody>
        </table>

      <chops-dialog closeonoutsideclick="">
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>
          <button aria-label="close">

          </button>

      </chops-dialog>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by frank...@gmail.com (Jul 2, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by frank...@gmail.com (Jul 2, 2022)
      </option>

          <!---->

        Description #1 by frank...@gmail.com (Jul 2, 2022)

      </div>
      Third party android application is able to bypass and download apk file without file extension warning. <span class="line"><!---->Third party android application is able to bypass and download apk file without file extension warning. <!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.70] + [stable]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.70] + [stable]<!----></span><br>Operating System: [Android] [Tested on Samsung Galaxy A12 with Android 11]<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: [Android] [Tested on Samsung Galaxy A12 with Android 11]<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>1: Install the attached application keyboard.apk. When the application is installed go to settings/general management/keyboard list and default and select the installed software keyboard (key2).<span class="line"><!---->1: Install the attached application keyboard.apk. When the application is installed go to settings/general management/keyboard list and default and select the installed software keyboard (key2).<!----></span><br><br>2: Open chrome and select the search bar. Press the POC button on the keyboard and chrome will download the Silence massage application without warning that the apk file could be dangerous.<span class="line"><!---->2: Open chrome and select the search bar. Press the POC button on the keyboard and chrome will download the Silence massage application without warning that the apk file could be dangerous.<!----></span><br><br>Optional: Go to settings/apps/key2 and allow storage permission, install unknown apps permission and all file access permission. This cause the app to try to install the file after downloading. This step is not necessary to prove that it is possible to bypass the download restrictions. <span class="line"><!---->Optional: Go to settings/apps/key2 and allow storage permission, install unknown apps permission and all file access permission. This cause the app to try to install the file after downloading. This step is not necessary to prove that it is possible to bypass the download restrictions. <!----></span><br><br><br>How this work:<span class="line"><!---->How this work:<!----></span><br>The application listens for an key event (Keyboard.KEYCODE_DELETE). When the key is pressed the keyboard injects a string/URL into the search bar. Chrome then loads the url and downloads the file.<span class="line"><!---->The application listens for an key event (Keyboard.KEYCODE_DELETE). When the key is pressed the keyboard injects a string/URL into the search bar. Chrome then loads the url and downloads the file.<!----></span><br><br><br>Files attached:<span class="line"><!---->Files attached:<!----></span><br>keyboard.apk - Proof of concept application.<span class="line"><!---->keyboard.apk - Proof of concept application.<!----></span><br>poc_class.txt - Text file with the java class injecting the URL.<span class="line"><!---->poc_class.txt - Text file with the java class injecting the URL.<!----></span><br>AA.mp4 - Proof of concept video.<span class="line"><!---->AA.mp4 - Proof of concept video.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          drubery@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          drubery@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This could possibly be considered a permissions bypass due to the suppressed dialog, though custom keyboards are very powerful/privileged pieces of software on the platform and generally speaking, existing installed malware is capable of significant damage outside of this use case. Redirecting to drubery@ to determine which side of our threat model this falls on.<span class="line"><!---->This could possibly be considered a permissions bypass due to the suppressed dialog, though custom keyboards are very powerful/privileged pieces of software on the platform and generally speaking, existing installed malware is capable of significant damage outside of this use case. Redirecting to drubery@ to determine which side of our threat model this falls on.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

          Comment 9<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1341485#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1341485#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jul 7, 2022, 6:51 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I share the concerns that this is outside our threat model. Couldn't the local malware just download the APK itself?<span class="line"><!---->I share the concerns that this is outside our threat model. Couldn't the local malware just download the APK itself?<!----></span><br><br>Even if it cant, I'm not sure the attached video demonstrates a download protection bypass. apk files are marked as "ALLOW_ON_USER_GESTURE" which can be very difficult to trigger, due to the fact that Safe Browsing verdicts usually override them. @frankapp.it - do you get a warning when you download that URL directly, without using your keyboard? Can you share a screenshot of that warning?<span class="line"><!---->Even if it cant, I'm not sure the attached video demonstrates a download protection bypass. apk files are marked as "ALLOW_ON_USER_GESTURE" which can be very difficult to trigger, due to the fact that Safe Browsing verdicts usually override them. @frankapp.it - do you get a warning when you download that URL directly, without using your keyboard? Can you share a screenshot of that warning?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          Comment 10<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1341485#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      frank...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/4196712458" title="frank...@gmail.com"><!---->frank...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      frank...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->frank...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Fri, Jul 8, 2022, 1:40 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jul 8, 2022, 1:40 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1341485#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jul 8, 2022, 1:40 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1341485#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Jul 8, 2022, 1:40 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        If I enter the URL address manually in the search field, I get no warning and the apk file is downloaded. If I visit the URL from a link or via a intent call from another application, I get the alert dialog. (see Harmful_file1.jpg) If I visit the website that hosts the file and I select it for download, I get a warning dialog (see Harmful_file2.jpg). <span class="line"><!---->If I enter the URL address manually in the search field, I get no warning and the apk file is downloaded. If I visit the URL from a link or via a intent call from another application, I get the alert dialog. (see Harmful_file1.jpg) If I visit the website that hosts the file and I select it for download, I get a warning dialog (see Harmful_file2.jpg). <!----></span><br>All above applies if I use safe browsing mode (see Enhanced_protection.jpg). (I also noticed that the injected URL does not appear under the history tab after injection.)<span class="line"><!---->All above applies if I use safe browsing mode (see Enhanced_protection.jpg). (I also noticed that the injected URL does not appear under the history tab after injection.)<!----></span><br><br>Local malware can download the application on its own. I used the keyboard apk as proof of the concept that a third party software could download via Chrome without any warning. I think this is dangerous and users should always be warned that this type of file could harm their cellphone.<span class="line"><!---->Local malware can download the application on its own. I used the keyboard apk as proof of the concept that a third party software could download via Chrome without any warning. I think this is dangerous and users should always be warned that this type of file could harm their cellphone.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I tested everthing in my last post on an iphone 12 with chrome installed as a reference. In all cases chrome warns before any download starts. Even though  apk files are not functional in iOS.<span class="line"><!---->I tested everthing in my last post on an iphone 12 with chrome installed as a reference. In all cases chrome warns before any download starts. Even though  apk files are not functional in iOS.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        "If I enter the URL address manually in the search field, I get no warning and the apk file is downloaded." - When I do this, I see the attached prompt. When the user is directly choosing the filename (and therefore file extension), we don't show these file type warnings.<span class="line"><!---->"If I enter the URL address manually in the search field, I get no warning and the apk file is downloaded." - When I do this, I see the attached prompt. When the user is directly choosing the filename (and therefore file extension), we don't show these file type warnings.<!----></span><br><br>I don't think the keyboard apk is interesting from a security perspective, since downloading a file through Chrome is strictly worse than downloading itself.<span class="line"><!---->I don't think the keyboard apk is interesting from a security perspective, since downloading a file through Chrome is strictly worse than downloading itself.<!----></span><br><br>I think everything is working as intended here.<span class="line"><!---->I think everything is working as intended here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Re <span class="line"><!---->Re <!----></span>#c13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c13"><!---->#c13<!----></a>: On Android, Chrome considers a download to be legitimate if the user navigated to the download URL via the omnibox. See this comment[1]. So I think it's WAI. drubery@, could you provide an update on this issue?           <strong><!---->Status:</strong>

        Thanks xinghuilu@ for the pointer in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks xinghuilu@ for the pointer in <!----></span>#c20<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c20"><!---->#c20<!----></a>. There's very little value in telling a user that a download is dangerous if the only thing we know about it is the file type, so we're trying to minimize how often we do that. I don't think this scenario meets the bar for showing a warning based on file type alone.<span class="line"><!---->. There's very little value in telling a user that a download is dangerous if the only thing we know about it is the file type, so we're trying to minimize how often we do that. I don't think this scenario meets the bar for showing a warning based on file type alone.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          Comment 28<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1341485#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          </div>
        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

        <slot></slot>
      </label>
